lineage.Process: Merge EuropaReproyectadaRECORTE;AfricaReproyectaRECORTE C:\Mapas\Hispania\ESPA2010\SHP\Bases2010ETRS89\AnexoETRS89\NAfrPtFretrs89.shp "ObjectID "ObjectID" true true false 9 Long 0 9 ,First,#,EuropaReproyectadaRECORTE,ObjectID,-1,-1,AfricaReproyectaRECORTE,OBJECTID,-1,-1;NUTS "NUTS" true true false 254 Text 0 0 ,First,#,EuropaReproyectadaRECORTE,NUTS,-1,-1;NAME "NAME" true true false 254 Text 0 0 ,First,#,EuropaReproyectadaRECORTE,NAME,-1,-1;AREA "AREA" true true false 19 Double 0 0 ,First,#,AfricaReproyectaRECORTE,AREA,-1,-1;SR "SR" true true false 19 Double 0 0 ,First,#,AfricaReproyectaRECORTE,SR,-1,-1"

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

descript.abstract:
Europe NUTS 3 Demographics represents areas of aggregated socioeconomic and demographic information at the NUTS 3 level for Europe. NUTS 3 units have an average population between 150,000 and 800,000 people.
NUTS (Nomenclature des Unités Territoriales Statistiques) refers to the Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics. For more information: http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nuts/home_regions_en.html.
descript.purpose: Europe NUTS 3 Demographics provides NUTS 3 level demographic information for Europe.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:200,000.

idinfo.useconst:
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to ESRI for inclusion on ESRI Data & Maps for use with ESRI® software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on ESRI Data & Maps. As used herein, “Geodata” shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Redistribution rights are granted by the data vendor for hard-copy renditions or static, electronic map images (for example, .gif, .jpeg,) that are plotted, printed, or publicly displayed with proper metadata and source/copyright attribution to the respective data vendor(s).
[Applicable to EuroGeographics only]–
End User Licence Agreement
between
EuroGeographics Association, 6-8, Avenue Blaise Pascal, Cité Descartes, Champs-sur-Marne, F-77455 Marne-la-Vallée Cedex 2, France Registration No. 435 131 842 00013 VAT No. FR 9343513184200013 Hereinafter referred to as the EuroGeographics
And
Licensee of Data & Maps Hereinafter referred to as the End User
E1 Definitions End User is a single person, company or otherwise recognisable legal body who will have usage rights to EuroBoundaryMap, as supplied by ESRI within the their Data & Maps cd-rom. Security Copy is a copy taken solely for the purpose of protecting against accidental loss or corruption. Product is EuroBoundaryMap. EuroBoundaryMap (formerly known as SABE - Seamless Administrative Boundaries of Europe) being a European wide structured digital geographic data base, derived from source data provided by the National Mapping Agencies of Europe. Reproduction includes any kind of reproduction of EuroBoundaryMap in any type or form, whether direct or indirect, permanent or intermediate, in analogue or digital form. It includes reproduction of value-added and derived products. Communication to the public includes distribution of physical products, and distribution by any other means or process, including wireless communication and broadcasting. It includes all instances of making accessible to the public, whether it is actually accessed or not. Usage rights are the rights to use for personal (if acquired by a person) or internal (if required by a legal person) use as defined in section E4. Employees shall not be entitled to usage rights for private purposes.
E2 Intellectual Property and Reservation of Ownership EuroBoundaryMap is the intellectual property of the National Mapping Authorities providing information for it. All reproductions of EuroBoundaryMap must carry the acknowledgement as specified in section E3. All unauthorised reproduction and distribution infringe this joint property right and could lead to legal action. This Agreement does not transfer any rights except what is clearly stated in the Agreement.
E3 Copyright and Trademark Acknowledgement Note Pursuant to the “Yes 1” classification in the Redistribution Rights Matrix, End User must show the appropriate copyright acknowledgement as detailed below on any hard copy renditions or static, electronic map images derived from EuroBoundaryMap. The acknowledgement that must be clearly shown is:
EuroBoundaryMap includes data licensed from European National Mapping and Cadastral Agencies, © EuroGeographics
Or in case of insufficient space:
© EuroGeographics
Any use of the name EuroGeographics and any other trademark registered to, or claimed by, EuroGeographics must show the appropriate trademark notation and an appropriate trade mark acknowledgement note must be shown somewhere on the document. This note may be omitted on very small items where there is insufficient room but the trademark notations must always be shown.
E4 Grant of Rights to End Users The End User acquires unlimited internal usage rights to EuroBoundaryMap on the following conditions: · EuroBoundaryMap may be installed on an unlimited number of personal computers or workstations within End User’s organisation. · The End User is authorised to make EuroBoundaryMap or images derived from EuroBoundaryMap available for viewing by the public in raster format on the domain address www.XXX of their World-Wide Web server and Intranet server only. Any presentation of EuroBoundaryMap (on screen or printed) must carry the acknowledgement as specified in section E3 (three). · The End User acknowledges that the Intellectual Property Rights in and to EuroBoundaryMap and any trademarks or service marks relating thereto remain the property of the EuroGeographics and its suppliers. · The End User is authorised to use reproductions of EuroBoundaryMap for reports and within presentations. · The End User can make a security copy of the EuroBoundaryMap data, taking all reasonable precautions to ensure that the EuroBoundaryMap product held on its premises is physically secure.
E5 Restrictions · At no stage will either the vector files of EuroBoundaryMap or the vector files derived from EuroBoundaryMap be made accessible to Internet users or to any other users outside of the End User organisation. · EuroBoundaryMap may not be used to provide a bureau service for others or for the benefit of or on behalf of others. · EuroBoundaryMap may not be used for any commercial activities other than stated in clause E4 (four), including commercial web services, unless the End User has a signed marketing rights agreement for EuroBoundaryMap with EuroGeographics. · The End User may not sell or onward sell the EuroBoundaryMap product.
E6 Disclaimer of Warranty, Limitation of Liability, and Exclusive Remedy The nature of EuroBoundaryMap is such that EuroGeographics cannot warrant the accuracy of EuroBoundaryMap. EuroBoundaryMap is provided “AS-IS” without warranty of any kind. EuroGeographics and any of the National Mapping and Cadastral Agencies are not inviting reliance on this Data, and End User should always verify actual Data.
EUROGEOGRAPHICS AND ANY OF THE NATIONAL MAPPING AND CADASTRAL AGENCIES DISCLAIM ALL OTHER WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND NONINFRINGEMENT. EUROGEOGRAPHICS DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET END USER’S NEEDS, OR THAT END USER’S OPERATION OF THE SAME WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR FREE, OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED.
IN NO EVENT SHALL EUROGEOGRAPHICS AND ANY OF THE NATIONAL MAPPING AND CADASTRAL AGENCIES BE LIABLE TO END USER FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS; LOST SALES OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES; INVESTMENTS; OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS, LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL, OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS LICENSE AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA OR DOCUMENTATION, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT EUROGEOGRAPHICS AND ANY OF THE NATIONAL MAPPING AND CADASTRAL AGENCIES HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED REMEDY.
The End User agrees that EuroGeographics’ sole liability and the End Users sole remedy in respect of any breach of Agreement shall be for EuroGeographics to replace the EuroBoundaryMap product.
E7 Indemnity The End User shall keep harmless and indemnify EuroGeographics against all claims, actions, suits, damages, liabilities, losses, charges and proceedings that EuroGeographics may incur or be put to as a direct result of any breach of this Agreement by the End User or its contractors.
E8 Dispute Resolution Before resorting to any external dispute resolution mechanism, the Parties shall attempt to settle by negotiation any dispute in relation to this Agreement. The Parties can decide to use a third person or institution as mediator in their negotiations. The Parties decide to what extent the mediator’s decisions will be binding. Disputes shall be handled by the courts of France or by arbitration if both Parties agree to it.
E9 Governing Law, Interpretation This Agreement shall be interpreted in all respects according to general principles of international contract law, as reflected in the UNIDROIT Principles of International Commercial Contracts, and be governed according to the law of France. Only the English language version of this Agreement shall be considered enforceable.
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on ESRI Data & Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of ESRI and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by ESRI and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: ESRI warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

ESRI SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES.
(B) TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LICENSEE AGREES TO INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, AND HOLD ESRI, ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUBCONTRACTORS, LICENSORS, SUCCESSORS, AND ASSIGNS HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL LIABILITY, LOSSES, CLAIMS, EXPENSES (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES), DEMANDS, OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH LICENSEE'S USE OR PERMITTING THE USE BY OTHERS OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES. DELIVERY OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A WAIVER OF THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS ARTICLE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of ESRI or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to ESRI with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and ESRI returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent areas of aggregated socioeconomic and demographic information at the NUTS 3 level for Europe.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The NUTS 3 code or the NUTS 0 code if there are no NUTS 3 geographical units for this country.

codesetd.codesetn: Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics (NUTS)
codesetd.codesets: Regulation of the European Parliament and of the Council on the establishment of a common classification of territorial units for statistics (NUTS)

attr.attrdef: The name of the NUTS geographical unit or the country if there are no NUTS 3 geographical units for this country.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: [Custom package for ESRI Data & Maps]
citeinfo.geoform: vector digital data and tabular digital data
citeinfo.othercit:
Michael Bauer Research GmbH provided the attribute data and boundary data.
EuroGeographics was the primary source for the boundary data.
The custom package included: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe and EuroBoundaryMap boundary data from EuroGeographics in the NUTS 0, NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3 shapefiles and table.

procstep.procdesc:
Michael Bauer Research GmbH established the data by reviewing relevant regional data and projecting the respective trends. For providing the most possible value to the user regarding comparability, all country results were projected by mathematical methods to the required geographical level, homogeneous base years, categories (e.g. age bands) and currency (Euro).
Other remarks: - For Azerbaijan the number of households, dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Vatican City only total population and population density are surveyed. - For Andorra, Liechtenstein, Georgia and San Marino the number of dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Gibraltar the number of dwellings, purchasing power growth rate and gross domestic product are not surveyed. - For Monaco and Kosovo the purchasing power growth rate is not surveyed. - In Russia only the European part of the country is surveyed (in accordance with the maps).
Michael Bauer Research GmbH provided ESRI with: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe and EuroBoundaryMap boundary data from EuroGeographics in the NUTS 0, NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3 shapefiles and table.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Started with the data in the custom package from Michael Bauer Research GmbH and EuroGeographics. The data included the four NUTS shapefiles and an Excel file that contained data for each of the four NUTS shapefiles. Converted the Excel file data into four geodatabase (.gdb) tables using Feature Manipulation Engine (FME). Joined each .gdb table to its corresponding NUTS shapefile. For data sets NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3, added and coded the NUTS0 field. Renamed some fields. Added the SQKM field to each of the four data sets and calculated its values. Converted the data sets to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices for each data set.
procstep.procsv: ArcGIS® 10, ArcGIS® 9, ArcView® GIS 3, Feature Manipulation Engine (FME®)

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either tools in ArcGIS or ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2). The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

dataIdInfo.envirDesc: Microsoft Windows Server 2008 R2 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0.0.2414
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Europe NUTS 3 Demographics represents areas of aggregated socioeconomic and demographic information at the NUTS 3 level for Europe. NUTS 3 units have an average population between 150,000 and 800,000 people.
NUTS (Nomenclature des Unités Territoriales Statistiques) refers to the Nomenclature of Territorial Units for Statistics. For more information: http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/ramon/nuts/home_regions_en.html.

Third Party Beneficiary: ESRI's licensor(s) has (have) authorized ESRI to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the ESRI licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to ESRI.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, ESRI has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

descKeys.keyword: polygon, countries, boundaries, demographics, NUTS, regions, society, economy

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr:
ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software.
In the United States, contact the ESRI Telebusiness staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local ESRI Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/company/locations.html.
distorOrdPrc.resFees: Software purchase price. ESRI Data & Maps is available only as part of ESRI® software. To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

dataLineage.statement:
MBR and EuroGeographics (source 1 of 1)
Michael Bauer Research GmbH, EuroGeographics, 201005, [Custom package for ESRI Data & Maps]: Michael Bauer Research GmbH; EuroGeographics, Nürnberg, Germany; Champs-sur-Marne, France.
Online links: http://www.mb-research.de/ http://www.eurogeographics.org/
Other citation details: Michael Bauer Research GmbH provided the attribute data and boundary data. EuroGeographics was the primary source for the boundary data. The custom package included: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe and EuroBoundaryMap boundary data from EuroGeographics in the NUTS 0, NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3 shapefiles and table.
Type of source media: online Source scale denominator: 100000 [EuroGeographics] Source contribution: Attribute and geospatial data
Date: 2010 (change 1 of 2) Michael Bauer Research GmbH established the data by reviewing relevant regional data and projecting the respective trends. For providing the most possible value to the user regarding comparability, all country results were projected by mathematical methods to the required geographical level, homogeneous base years, categories (e.g. age bands) and currency (Euro).
Other remarks: - For Azerbaijan the number of households, dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Vatican City only total population and population density are surveyed. - For Andorra, Liechtenstein, Georgia and San Marino the number of dwellings and purchasing power growth rate are not surveyed. - For Gibraltar the number of dwellings, purchasing power growth rate and gross domestic product are not surveyed. - For Monaco and Kosovo the purchasing power growth rate is not surveyed. - In Russia only the European part of the country is surveyed (in accordance with the maps).
Michael Bauer Research GmbH provided ESRI with: MBR - Economic and Sociodemographic Data for Europe and EuroBoundaryMap boundary data from EuroGeographics in the NUTS 0, NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3 shapefiles and table.
Data sources produced in this process: MBR and EuroGeographics
Date: 20100519 (change 2 of 2) The following steps were performed by ESRI: Started with the data in the custom package from Michael Bauer Research GmbH and EuroGeographics. The data included the four NUTS shapefiles and an Excel file that contained data for each of the four NUTS shapefiles. Converted the Excel file data into four geodatabase (.gdb) tables using Feature Manipulation Engine (FME). Joined each .gdb table to its corresponding NUTS shapefile. For data sets NUTS 1, NUTS 2, and NUTS 3, added and coded the NUTS0 field. Renamed some fields. Added the SQKM field to each of the four data sets and calculated its values. Converted the data sets to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices for each data set.
Data sources used in this process: MBR and EuroGeographics
